basics.name: Cameron Green
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Full Stack Web Developer able to build a sophisticated website with full database backend all the way from mockup to rollout. Adept at working with diverse teams to implement projects. Flexible developer with strong communication skills and experience in diverse environments.

jobs.summary: Leading front-end development initiatives for wm.com, creating modern, scalable web applications.
Transformed manual banking processes into modern solutions for Investment & Corporate Bankers, delivering intuitive user experiences and productivity tools.
highlights: Developed Microsoft PowerPoint Productivity Extension automating formatting and standardization for 30,000+ internal users (.Net Framework, MongoDB, NUnit, Moq)
Built custom Content Management System enabling users to insert curated images and slides, streamlining content creation workflows
Created web-based CMS with SSO authentication using JPMC web authentication, providing secure asset management for Office applications (React, Redux, .Net Core, MongoDB)
Provided level 3 technical support for mission-critical applications and managed bi-weekly release cycles
Collaborated with business partners to understand banker needs and translate requirements into technical solutions

jobs.summary: Collaborated on agile development team delivering enterprise applications using .Net Core MVC, DynamoDB, and Android.
highlights: Developed digital information card application, working with business associates to gather requirements and display client information (.Net Core, Angular 8)
Built appointment scheduling web application enabling representatives to set availabilities and users to schedule appointments with email notification system (.Net Core, Angular 6)
Created web-based graphical CMS with visual editor for client presentation application, replacing hundreds of dropdowns with intuitive interface inspired by Figma and Adobe XD (Angular 8, JavaScript)
Participated in agile ceremonies including daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospectives to deliver iterative value

jobs.summary: In two months built a full stack application using Ionic 2. This app was used to gather information for ARI. When users were back at the base, they would connect their tablets and upload the data to a server which stored all the data. The server ran a script which would go through and parse the data for different uses around the company.
highlights: Built full-stack application in 2 months using Ionic 2
Developed data collection and synchronization system
Created automated data parsing and distribution system

jobs.summary: Progressed from ground-level intern to Systems Administrator, managing all electronic devices and IT infrastructure across multiple office locations.
highlights: Advanced from IT support intern to full Systems Administrator, demonstrating rapid technical growth and reliability
Managed and maintained all electronic devices, networks, and systems across multiple office locations
Administered user accounts, security policies, and access controls to ensure data protection and compliance

schools.description: Acquired skills for teamwork and created small projects for classes.
Developed my passion for Computer Science, I learned the basics of programming and algorithm usage.

volunteer.summary: For my Eagle Project I coordinated over 1600 service hours.

projects.name: Interval Timer
projects.description: For fun, and to practice my design chops, I created this interval timer and published it cross platform.
highlights: Cross-platform timer application
Published on web, Android, and iOS

projects.name: Vertical Solitaire
projects.description: I had been playing with JS Canvas and wanted to practice more. I didn't like my current solitaire app, So I decided to make one.
highlights: Built with JavaScript Canvas
Published on Android and iOS

projects.name: Overwatch GraphQL API
projects.description: Built a graphql api to list the overwatch heroes and maps that are currently released in the game

projects.name: Americans for Responsible Insurance
projects.description: ARI was created from 0 to a solid beta in just 24 days. The app needed to be in a preview phase for investors as soon as possible. Using Ionic 2 and AngularJS, I prototyped the app, back end server including an automated email system, and database storage within those 24 days. Unfortunately the startup fell through from financial burdens.
highlights: Full-stack app built in 24 days
Ionic 2 and AngularJS
Backend server with automated email system
Database storage system
I have IP rights to all the code in ARI, if requested I can share it

projects.name: Code Chat
projects.description: During my Fall semester in 2017, I worked with a 9-man team to design and build any project we desired. We decided to build a chatting application that could run and compile code immediately. I was the lead programmer for all JavaScript modules within front-end and back-end. Our whole system utilizes websockets between the webapp, the chat server, and the compiling server, making it as network performant as possible.
highlights: 9-person team project
Real-time code compilation and execution
WebSocket-based architecture
Lead JavaScript programmer

projects.name: My Pantry
projects.description: To work on my SQL skills and to show off my JavaScript abilities, I decided to build the classic todo app, but of course with a small twist. The front end of the app is in pure JavaScript with the exception of using axios for http requests. The back end is written in node and uses PostgreSQL for the SQL database. There is a basic register/login system encrypted with crypto-js.
highlights: Pure JavaScript frontend (with axios)
Node.js backend
PostgreSQL database
Encrypted authentication with crypto-js

projects.name: Overwatch Wallpapers
projects.description: In 2016 to cement my knowledge of Angular, and fuel my excitement for the coming release of Overwatch, I decided to build the Overwatch Wallpapers website over a weekend. The website allows you to search by heroes, maps, and artists and also hit one button to download a zip of all images on the site. You could also click the image of a hero and it would show all saved wallpaper images of that hero.
highlights: Built in one weekend
Angular-based application
Search functionality by heroes, maps, and artists
Bulk download feature
Plan to rebuild with Vue or React with backend upload/removal capabilities

projects.name: Instagram Scraper
projects.description: A professor asked me to get him a picture of every image in a school's Instagram page for his research. Using NightmareJS I was able to easily screenshot each image from a config file and then place each image into a folder from each page.
highlights: NightmareJS web scraping
Automated screenshot capture
Configurable batch processing
